### 2. –ö–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã–µ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è

*   **R-3: –ê–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫:** –ï—Å–ª–∏ –¥–ª—è –Ω–µ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â–µ–π —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –æ–¥–∏–Ω –æ–¥–Ω–æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–Ω—ã–π –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è (–Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –∏–º—è —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–µ), —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–∞ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è—Ç—å –ø—É—Ç—å –≤ –∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥–Ω–æ–º Markdown-—Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ –±–µ–∑ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏—è –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è.
*   **R-4: –£–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º:** –ü–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å –¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω –∏–º–µ—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –æ—Ç–∫–ª—é—á–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫—É —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫ –∏–ª–∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é —Ñ–ª–∞–≥–æ–≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∫–∏.

### 3. –î–µ—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ø–ª–∞–Ω —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏

#### 3.1. –ê–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –∏ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –æ–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –ø—É—Ç–µ–π (Verification)

**–ó–∞–¥–∞—á–∞:** –£–±–µ–¥–∏—Ç—å—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—É—Ç–µ–π –µ–¥–∏–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ –ø–æ –≤—Å–µ–º—É –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç—É.

**–î–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è:**
1.  **–ü—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç:** –ü—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –≤—Å–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è `path.resolve`, `path.join` –∏ `path.relative` –≤ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏—Ö –º–æ–¥—É–ª—è—Ö:
    *   `src/links/LinkVerifier.ts`
    *   `src/links/LinkResolver.ts`
    *   `src/dependencies/DependencyManager.ts`

2.  **–°—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å:** –£—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å –≤ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–∞ –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–π –ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω:
    ```typescript
    path.resolve(dirname(sourceFilePath), relativeLinkPath)
    ```
    –¢–µ–∫—É—â–∏–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω —É–∂–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ –∫–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã—Ö –º–æ–¥—É–ª–µ–π. –ù–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–∏—Ç—å –µ–≥–æ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≥–æ–µ —Å–æ–±–ª—é–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏ –≤–Ω–µ—Å–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–π.

#### 3.2. –í–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–¥—É–ª—è: `AutoRepairer`

**–ó–∞–¥–∞—á–∞:** –°–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –º–æ–¥—É–ª—å –¥–ª—è –ª–æ–≥–∏–∫–∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –∏–∑–±–µ–∂–∞—Ç—å —É—Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏—Ö –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤.

**–†–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è:**
1.  **–°–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–π —Ñ–∞–π–ª:** `src/links/AutoRepairer.ts`.
2.  **–û–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å `AutoRepairer`** —Å–æ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–µ–π —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä–æ–π:

    ```typescript
    // src/links/AutoRepairer.ts
    import { writeFileSync, readFileSync } from 'node:fs';
    import { LinkScanner } from './LinkScanner';
    import { LinkVerifier } from './LinkVerifier';
    import { LinkResolver } from './LinkResolver';
    import type { BrokenLink, FileScanResult } from './types';

    export class AutoRepairer {
        private scanner = new LinkScanner();
        private verifier = new LinkVerifier();
        private resolver = new LinkResolver();

        /**
         * Scans a file or directory, attempts to auto-repair high-confidence broken links,
         * and reports any remaining broken links.
         * @param targetPath The file or directory path to process.
         * @returns An object detailing the operation results.
         */
        public async autoRepair(targetPath: string): Promise<{
            repairedLinksCount: number;
            repairedFilesIn: Set<string>;
            remainingBrokenLinks: BrokenLink[];
        }> {
            const filesToScan = await this.scanner.findMarkdownFiles(targetPath);
            let repairedLinksCount = 0;
            const repairedFilesIn = new Set<string>();
            let allBrokenLinks: BrokenLink[] = [];

            for (const file of filesToScan) {
                const scanResult = await this.scanner.scanFile(file);
                const verifiedResult = await this.verifier.verifyLinks(scanResult);
                if (verifiedResult.brokenLinks.length === 0) continue;

                const resolvedResult = await this.resolver.resolveBrokenLinks([verifiedResult]);
                const fixableLinks = resolvedResult[0]?.brokenLinks.filter(l => l.suggestions.length === 1) || [];

                if (fixableLinks.length > 0) {
                    this.applyFixesToFile(file, fixableLinks);
                    repairedLinksCount += fixableLinks.length;
                    repairedFilesIn.add(file);
                    console.log(`üîß Auto-repaired ${fixableLinks.length} link(s) in ${file}`);
                }
            }

            // Re-verify all files to find remaining broken links
            const finalResults: FileScanResult[] = [];
            for (const file of filesToScan) {
                const scanResult = await this.scanner.scanFile(file);
                const verifiedResult = await this.verifier.verifyLinks(scanResult);
                finalResults.push(verifiedResult);
            }
            allBrokenLinks = finalResults.flatMap(r => r.brokenLinks);

            return {
                repairedLinksCount,
                repairedFilesIn,
                remainingBrokenLinks: allBrokenLinks
            };
        }

        private applyFixesToFile(filePath: string, linksToFix: BrokenLink[]): void {
            let content = readFileSync(filePath, 'utf-8');
            for (const brokenLink of linksToFix) {
                const bestFix = this.resolver.getBestSuggestion(brokenLink);
                if (bestFix) {
                    const originalLinkText = `[${brokenLink.link.text}](${brokenLink.link.href})`;
                    const newLinkText = `[${brokenLink.link.text}](${bestFix})`;
                    content = content.replace(originalLinkText, newLinkText);
                }
            }
            writeFileSync(filePath, content, 'utf-8');
        }
    }
    ```

3.  **–≠–∫—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å `AutoRepairer`** –∏–∑ `src/links/index.ts`.

#### 3.3. –ò–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—É `publish`

**–ó–∞–¥–∞—á–∞:** –í—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—É—é –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫—É –∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ-–∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å –ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏.

**–†–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è:**
1.  **–û–±–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å `src/cli/EnhancedCommands.ts`:**
    *   –í –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–µ `addPublishCommand` –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ –æ–ø—Ü–∏–∏:
        ```typescript
        .option("--no-verify", "Skip mandatory local link verification before publishing")
        .option("--no-auto-repair", "Disable automatic link repair (publication will fail if broken links are found)")
        ```
    *   –í –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–µ `handleUnifiedPublishCommand` (–∏ `handleDirectoryPublish`) –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –≤—ã–∑–æ–≤–æ–º `publisher.publishWithMetadata` –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–π –±–ª–æ–∫ –ª–æ–≥–∏–∫–∏:

    ```typescript
    // src/cli/EnhancedCommands.ts -> handleUnifiedPublishCommand

    // ... (after loading config and before publisher.publishWithMetadata)

    if (!options.noVerify) {
        ProgressIndicator.showStatus("üîé Verifying local links...", "info");
        const { AutoRepairer } = await import('../links/AutoRepairer');
        const repairer = new AutoRepairer();
        const targetPath = options.file || process.cwd();

        let remainingBrokenLinks: BrokenLink[] = [];

        if (!options.noAutoRepair) {
            const repairResult = await repairer.autoRepair(targetPath);
            if (repairResult.repairedLinksCount > 0) {
                ProgressIndicator.showStatus(`üîß Automatically repaired ${repairResult.repairedLinksCount} link(s) in ${repairResult.repairedFilesIn.size} file(s).`, "success");
            }
            remainingBrokenLinks = repairResult.remainingBrokenLinks;
        } else {
            // Verification only, no repair
            const scanner = new (await import('../links/LinkScanner')).LinkScanner();
            const verifier = new (await import('../links/LinkVerifier')).LinkVerifier();
            const files = await scanner.findMarkdownFiles(targetPath);
            for(const file of files) {
                const scanResult = await scanner.scanFile(file);
                const verified = await verifier.verifyLinks(scanResult);
                remainingBrokenLinks.push(...verified.brokenLinks);
            }
        }

        if (remainingBrokenLinks.length > 0) {
            ProgressIndicator.showStatus(`Publication aborted. Found ${remainingBrokenLinks.length} broken link(s):`, "error");
            const linksByFile = new Map<string, string[]>();
            for (const broken of remainingBrokenLinks) {
                if (!linksByFile.has(broken.filePath)) {
                    linksByFile.set(broken.filePath, []);
                }
                linksByFile.get(broken.filePath)?.push(`  - "${broken.link.href}" (line ${broken.link.lineNumber})`);
            }
            for (const [file, links] of linksByFile.entries()) {
                console.log(`\nüìÑ In file: ${file}`);
                links.forEach(link => console.log(link));
            }
            console.log("\nüí° Tip: Run 'telegraph-publisher check-links --apply-fixes' to repair them interactively, or fix them manually.");
            process.exit(1);
        } else {
            ProgressIndicator.showStatus("‚úÖ Link verification passed.", "success");
        }
    }

    // ... (rest of the publish logic)
    ```

### 4. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–µ–º–∫–∏

*   **AC-1:** –ö–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ `telegraph-publisher pub` –±–µ–∑ —Ñ–ª–∞–≥–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –µ—Å–ª–∏ –≤ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ –∏–ª–∏ –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –µ—Å—Ç—å –Ω–µ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â–∏–µ –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –Ω–µ —É–¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏.
*   **AC-2:** –°–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ–± –æ—à–∏–±–∫–µ –ø—Ä–∏ –ø—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏—Ç –ø–æ–ª–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—à–∏—Ö—Å—è –Ω–µ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â–∏—Ö —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫ –∏ –ø—É—Ç–∏ –∫ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞–º, –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –æ–Ω–∏ –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç—Å—è.
*   **AC-3:** –ö–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ `telegraph-publisher pub` –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç –Ω–µ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â—É—é —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫—É, –µ—Å–ª–∏ –¥–ª—è –Ω–µ–µ –Ω–∞–π–¥–µ–Ω —Ä–æ–≤–Ω–æ –æ–¥–∏–Ω –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è, –∏ –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Å–æ–ª—å —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ–± —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ–º –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–∏.
*   **AC-4:** –ö–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ `telegraph-publisher pub --no-auto-repair` –Ω–µ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏, –∞ –ø—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –µ—Å–ª–∏ –Ω–∞–π–¥–µ–Ω—ã –Ω–µ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â–∏–µ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏ (–¥–∞–∂–µ –µ—Å–ª–∏ –∏—Ö –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å).
*   **AC-5:** –ö–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ `telegraph-publisher pub --no-verify` —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è–µ—Ç –ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—é, –∏–≥–Ω–æ—Ä–∏—Ä—É—è –Ω–∞–ª–∏—á–∏–µ –Ω–µ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â–∏—Ö —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫.
*   **AC-6:** –õ–æ–≥–∏–∫–∞ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø—É—Ç–µ–π –¥–ª—è —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫ –≤–∏–¥–∞ `../sibling/file.md` –∏ `./same_dir.md` —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–Ω–æ –≤–æ –≤—Å–µ—Ö —á–∞—Å—Ç—è—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã (–ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∞ —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫, –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π).

### Rule: use-bun-instead-of-node-vite-npm-pnpm

**Use Bun instead of Node.js, npm, pnpm, or vite.**

```markdown
Default to using Bun instead of Node.js.

- Use `bun <file>` instead of `node <file>` or `ts-node <file>`
- Use `bun test` instead of `jest` or `vitest`
- Use `bun build <file.html|file.ts|file.css>` instead of `webpack` or `esbuild`
- Use `bun install` instead of `npm install` or `yarn install` or `pnpm install`
- Use `bun run <script>` instead of `npm run <script>` or `yarn run <script>` or `pnpm run <script>`
- Bun automatically loads .env, so don't use dotenv.

## APIs

- `Bun.serve()` supports WebSockets, HTTPS, and routes. Don't use `express`.
- `bun:sqlite` for SQLite. Don't use `better-sqlite3`.
- `Bun.redis` for Redis. Don't use `ioredis`.
- `Bun.sql` for Postgres. Don't use `pg` or `postgres.js`.
- `WebSocket` is built-in. Don't use `ws`.
- Prefer `Bun.file` over `node:fs`'s readFile/writeFile
- Bun.$`ls` instead of execa.

## Testing

Use `bun test` to run tests.

```ts#index.test.ts
import { test, expect } from "bun:test";

test("hello world", () => {
  expect(1).toBe(1);
});
```

## Frontend

Use HTML imports with `Bun.serve()`. Don't use `vite`. HTML imports fully support React, CSS, Tailwind.

Server:

```ts#index.ts
import index from "./index.html"

Bun.serve({
  routes: {
    "/": index,
    "/api/users/:id": {
      GET: (req) => {
        return new Response(JSON.stringify({ id: req.params.id }));
      },
    },
  },
  // optional websocket support
  websocket: {
    open: (ws) => {
      ws.send("Hello, world!");
    },
    message: (ws, message) => {
      ws.send(message);
    },
    close: (ws) => {
      // handle close
    }
  },
  development: {
    hmr: true,
    console: true,
  }
})
```

HTML files can import .tsx, .jsx or .js files directly and Bun's bundler will transpile & bundle automatically. `<link>` tags can point to stylesheets and Bun's CSS bundler will bundle.

```html#index.html
<html>
  <body>
    <h1>Hello, world!</h1>
    <script type="module" src="./frontend.tsx"></script>
  </body>
</html>
```

With the following `frontend.tsx`:

```tsx#frontend.tsx
import React from "react";

// import .css files directly and it works
import './index.css';

import { createRoot } from "react-dom/client";

const root = createRoot(document.body);

export default function Frontend() {
  return <h1>Hello, world!</h1>;
}

root.render(<Frontend />);
```

Then, run index.ts

```sh
bun --hot ./index.ts
```

For more information, read the Bun API docs in `node_modules/bun-types/docs/**.md`.
```

–Ø –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª –ø–æ–¥—Ä–æ–±–Ω—É—é —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫—É—é —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—é –ø–æ —É–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏—é –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∏ –∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ü–∏–∏ —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫ –≤ —É—Ç–∏–ª–∏—Ç–µ `telegraph-publisher`. –ú–æ–π –ø–ª–∞–Ω –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞–µ—Ç –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –æ–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –ø—É—Ç–µ–π, —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–¥—É–ª—è `AutoRepairer` –∏ –µ–≥–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—é –≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—É `publish`.

*   **`LinkVerifier.ts`**: –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç `path.resolve(sourceDir, linkHref)` –¥–ª—è –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—É—Ç–µ–π –∏ `path.resolve(projectRoot, linkHref.slice(1))` –¥–ª—è –∞–±—Å–æ–ª—é—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—É—Ç–µ–π, —á—Ç–æ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç—É. –¢–∞–∫–∂–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è `dirname` –∏ `join` –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫–∞ `projectRoot`.
*   **`LinkResolver.ts`**: –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç `relative(sourceDir, candidateFile)` –¥–ª—è –≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—É—Ç–µ–π –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π. –¢–∞–∫–∂–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å –≤—Å–ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥—ã `LinkResolver.resolveLocalPath(path, basePath)` –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç `resolve(baseDir, relativePath)` –∏ `dirname(basePath)`.
*   **`DependencyManager.ts`**: –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç `resolve(dirname(filePath), link.href)` –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø—É—Ç–µ–π –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫, —á—Ç–æ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç—É.
*   **`ContentProcessor.ts`**: –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç `LinkResolver.findLocalLinks(contentWithoutMetadata, basePath)` –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –≤ —Å–≤–æ—é –æ—á–µ—Ä–µ–¥—å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç `LinkResolver.resolveLocalPath` –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—É—Ç–µ–π.

–í —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º, –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ `path.resolve` –∏ `dirname` –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—É—Ç–µ–π —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ–º–æ–º—É —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç—É. –í—Å–µ –º–æ–¥—É–ª–∏, –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ, –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É—é—Ç –∫–æ–Ω—Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥.

–¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –ø—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞—é –∫ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–¥—É–ª—è `AutoRepairer`. –Ø —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–º –Ω–æ–≤—ã–π —Ñ–∞–π–ª `src/links/AutoRepairer.ts` –∏ –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—é –≤ –Ω–µ–º –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å `AutoRepairer`, –∫–∞–∫ —É–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–æ –≤ —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –ó–∞—Ç–µ–º —è —ç–∫—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ä—É—é —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å –∏–∑ `src/links/index.ts`.

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,72 @@
- 
+ import { writeFileSync, readFileSync } from 'node:fs';
+ import { LinkScanner } from './LinkScanner';
+ import { LinkVerifier } from './LinkVerifier';
+ import { LinkResolver } from './LinkResolver';
+ import type { BrokenLink, FileScanResult } from './types';
+ 
+ export class AutoRepairer {
+     private scanner = new LinkScanner();
+     private verifier = new LinkVerifier();
+     private resolver = new LinkResolver();
+ 
+     /**
+      * Scans a file or directory, attempts to auto-repair high-confidence broken links,
+      * and reports any remaining broken links.
+      * @param targetPath The file or directory path to process.
+      * @returns An object detailing the operation results.
+      */
+     public async autoRepair(targetPath: string): Promise<{
+         repairedLinksCount: number;
+         repairedFilesIn: Set<string>;
+         remainingBrokenLinks: BrokenLink[];
+     }> {
+         const filesToScan = await this.scanner.findMarkdownFiles(targetPath);
+         let repairedLinksCount = 0;
+         const repairedFilesIn = new Set<string>();
+         let allBrokenLinks: BrokenLink[] = [];
+ 
+         for (const file of filesToScan) {
+             const scanResult = await this.scanner.scanFile(file);
+             const verifiedResult = await this.verifier.verifyLinks(scanResult);
+             if (verifiedResult.brokenLinks.length === 0) continue;
+ 
+             const resolvedResult = await this.resolver.resolveBrokenLinks([verifiedResult]);
+             const fixableLinks = resolvedResult[0]?.brokenLinks.filter(l => l.suggestions.length === 1) || [];
+ 
+             if (fixableLinks.length > 0) {
+                 this.applyFixesToFile(file, fixableLinks);
+                 repairedLinksCount += fixableLinks.length;
+                 repairedFilesIn.add(file);
+                 console.log(`üîß Auto-repaired ${fixableLinks.length} link(s) in ${file}`);
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         // Re-verify all files to find remaining broken links
+         const finalResults: FileScanResult[] = [];
+         for (const file of filesToScan) {
+             const scanResult = await this.scanner.scanFile(file);
+             const verifiedResult = await this.verifier.verifyLinks(scanResult);
+             finalResults.push(verifiedResult);
+         }
+         allBrokenLinks = finalResults.flatMap(r => r.brokenLinks);
+ 
+         return {
+             repairedLinksCount,
+             repairedFilesIn,
+             remainingBrokenLinks: allBrokenLinks
+         };
+     }
+ 
+     private applyFixesToFile(filePath: string, linksToFix: BrokenLink[]): void {
+         let content = readFileSync(filePath, 'utf-8');
+         for (const brokenLink of linksToFix) {
+             const bestFix = this.resolver.getBestSuggestion(brokenLink);
+             if (bestFix) {
+                 const originalLinkText = `[${brokenLink.link.text}](${brokenLink.link.href})`;
+                 const newLinkText = `[${brokenLink.link.text}](${bestFix})`;
+                 content = content.replace(originalLinkText, newLinkText);
+             }
+         }
+         writeFileSync(filePath, content, 'utf-8');
+     }
+ }
```

@@ -1,1 +1,72 @@
- 
+ import { existsSync } from 'node:fs';
+ import { dirname, isAbsolute, join, resolve as pathResolve } from 'node:path';
+ 
+ /**
+  * PathResolver provides a unified mechanism for resolving file paths.
+  * This class is designed to be a singleton or instantiated once and passed around.
+  */
+ export class PathResolver {
+     private static instance: PathResolver;
+     private projectRootCache: Map<string, string> = new Map();
+ 
+     private constructor() {}
+ 
+     public static getInstance(): PathResolver {
+         if (!PathResolver.instance) {
+             PathResolver.instance = new PathResolver();
+         }
+         return PathResolver.instance;
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Finds the project root directory by searching upwards for package.json or .git.
+      * Results are cached for performance.
+      * @param startPath The path to start searching from.
+      * @returns The absolute path to the project root.
+      */
+     public findProjectRoot(startPath: string): string {
+         const normalizedStartPath = pathResolve(startPath);
+         if (this.projectRootCache.has(normalizedStartPath)) {
+             return this.projectRootCache.get(normalizedStartPath)!;
+         }
+ 
+         let currentPath = dirname(normalizedStartPath);
+         const root = pathResolve('/');
+ 
+         while (currentPath !== root) {
+             if (existsSync(join(currentPath, 'package.json')) || existsSync(join(currentPath, '.git'))) {
+                 this.projectRootCache.set(normalizedStartPath, currentPath);
+                 return currentPath;
+             }
+ 
+             const parentPath = dirname(currentPath);
+             if (parentPath === currentPath) {
+                 break; // Reached the file system root
+             }
+             currentPath = parentPath;
+         }
+ 
+         // If no project root found, use the directory containing the start file/path
+         const finalRoot = dirname(normalizedStartPath);
+         this.projectRootCache.set(normalizedStartPath, finalRoot);
+         return finalRoot;
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Resolves a link path relative to a base path or the project root.
+      * @param fromPath The base path (usually the source file's path).
+      * @param linkHref The link href to resolve.
+      * @returns The absolute resolved path.
+      */
+     public resolve(fromPath: string, linkHref: string): string {
+         // If linkHref starts with /, resolve relative to the project root.
+         if (isAbsolute(linkHref)) {
+             const projectRoot = this.findProjectRoot(fromPath);
+             return pathResolve(projectRoot, linkHref.slice(1)); // Remove leading slash
+         }
+ 
+         // If linkHref is relative (e.g., ./ or ../), resolve relative to the directory of fromPath.
+         const fromDir = dirname(fromPath);
+         return pathResolve(fromDir, linkHref);
+     }
+ }
```

</details>

+ import { ConfigManager } from '../config/ConfigManager';
+ import { EnhancedTelegraphPublisher } from '../publisher/EnhancedTelegraphPublisher';
+ import { AutoRepairer } from '../links/AutoRepairer';
+ import { LinkScanner } from '../links/LinkScanner';
+ import { LinkVerifier } from '../links/LinkVerifier';
+ import { LinkResolver } from '../links/LinkResolver';
+ import { PathResolver } from '../utils/PathResolver';
+ import { ProgressIndicator } from '../cli/ProgressIndicator';
+ import type { MetadataConfig, BrokenLink, FileScanResult } from '../types/metadata';
+ 
+ /**
+  * Orchestrates the publication workflow, including link verification and auto-repair.
+  */
+ export class PublicationWorkflowManager {
+     private config: MetadataConfig;
+     private accessToken: string;
+     private pathResolver: PathResolver;
+     private linkScanner: LinkScanner;
+     private linkVerifier: LinkVerifier;
+     private linkResolver: LinkResolver;
+     private autoRepairer: AutoRepairer;
+     private publisher: EnhancedTelegraphPublisher;
+ 
+     constructor(config: MetadataConfig, accessToken: string) {
+         this.config = config;
+         this.accessToken = accessToken;
+         this.pathResolver = PathResolver.getInstance();
+         this.linkScanner = new LinkScanner();
+         this.linkVerifier = new LinkVerifier(this.pathResolver);
+         this.linkResolver = new LinkResolver();
+         this.autoRepairer = new AutoRepairer();
+         this.publisher = new EnhancedTelegraphPublisher(this.config);
+         this.publisher.setAccessToken(this.accessToken);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Handles the entire publication workflow, including link verification and auto-repair.
+      * @param targetPath The file or directory path to process.
+      * @param options Command options.
+      */
+     public async publish(targetPath: string, options: any): Promise<void> {
+         // –®–∞–≥ 1: –°–±–æ—Ä —Ñ–∞–π–ª–æ–≤.
+         const filesToProcess = targetPath === process.cwd() ?
+                                 await this.linkScanner.findMarkdownFiles(targetPath) :
+                                 [targetPath];
+ 
+         if (filesToProcess.length === 0) {
+             ProgressIndicator.showStatus("No markdown files found to publish.", "info");
+             return;
+         }
+ 
+         let allBrokenLinks: BrokenLink[] = [];
+ 
+         if (!options.noVerify) {
+             ProgressIndicator.showStatus("üîé Verifying local links...", "info");
+             let needsReverification = true;
+ 
+             while (needsReverification) {
+                 needsReverification = false;
+                 allBrokenLinks = [];
+ 
+                 for (const file of filesToProcess) {
+                     const scanResult = await this.linkScanner.scanFile(file);
+                     const verifiedResult = await this.linkVerifier.verifyLinks(scanResult);
+                     allBrokenLinks.push(...verifiedResult.brokenLinks);
+                 }
+ 
+                 if (allBrokenLinks.length > 0 && !options.noAutoRepair) {
+                     const fixableLinks = (await this.linkResolver.resolveBrokenLinks([{...allBrokenLinks[0], brokenLinks: allBrokenLinks} as FileScanResult]))[0]?.brokenLinks.filter(l => l.suggestions.length === 1) || [];
+ 
+                     if (fixableLinks.length > 0) {
+                         ProgressIndicator.showStatus(`üîß Attempting to auto-repair ${fixableLinks.length} link(s)...`, "info");
+                         const repairResult = await this.autoRepairer.autoRepair(targetPath);
+                         if (repairResult.repairedLinksCount > 0) {
+                             ProgressIndicator.showStatus(`üîß Automatically repaired ${repairResult.repairedLinksCount} link(s) in ${repairResult.repairedFilesIn.size} file(s).`, "success");
+                             needsReverification = true; // Re-verify after repair
+                         }
+                     }
+                 }
+             }
+ 
+             // –®–∞–≥ 4: –§–∏–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∞ –∏ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç–∏–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è.
+             if (allBrokenLinks.length > 0) {
+                 ProgressIndicator.showStatus(`Publication aborted. Found ${allBrokenLinks.length} broken link(s):`, "error");
+                 const linksByFile = new Map<string, string[]>();
+                 for (const broken of allBrokenLinks) {
+                     if (!linksByFile.has(broken.filePath)) {
+                         linksByFile.set(broken.filePath, []);
+                     }
+                     linksByFile.get(broken.filePath)?.push(`  - "${broken.link.href}" (line ${broken.link.lineNumber})`);
+                 }
+                 for (const [file, links] of linksByFile.entries()) {
+                     console.log(`\nüìÑ In file: ${file}`);
+                     links.forEach(link => console.log(link));
+                 }
+                 console.log("\nüí° Tip: Run 'telegraph-publisher check-links --apply-fixes' to repair them interactively, or fix them manually.");
+                 process.exit(1);
+             } else {
+                 ProgressIndicator.showStatus("‚úÖ Link verification passed.", "success");
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         // –®–∞–≥ 5: –ü—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è.
+         for (const file of filesToProcess) {
+             ProgressIndicator.showStatus(`‚öôÔ∏è Publishing: ${file}`, "info");
+             const result = await this.publisher.publishWithMetadata(file, this.config.defaultUsername, {
+                 withDependencies: options.withDependencies !== false,
+                 forceRepublish: options.forceRepublish || false,
+                 dryRun: options.dryRun || false
+             });
+ 
+             if (result.success) {
+                 ProgressIndicator.showStatus(`${result.isNewPublication ? "Published" : "Updated"} successfully!`, "success");
+                 if (result.url) {
+                     console.log(`üîó URL: ${result.url}`);
+                 }
+                 if (result.path) {
+                     console.log(`üìç Path: ${result.path}`);

+ import { test, expect, beforeAll, afterEach, jest } from "bun:test";
+ import { PathResolver } from "./PathResolver";
+ import { existsSync as fsExistsSync, readFileSync as fsReadFileSync, writeFileSync as fsWriteFileSync } from 'node:fs';
+ import { resolve as nodePathResolve, join as nodePathJoin } from 'node:path';
+ 
+ // Mock the fs module to control file system behavior for tests
+ jest.mock('node:fs', () => ({
+     existsSync: jest.fn(),
+     readFileSync: jest.fn(),
+     writeFileSync: jest.fn(),
+ }));
+ 
+ const existsSync = fsExistsSync as jest.Mock;
+ const readFileSync = fsReadFileSync as jest.Mock;
+ const writeFileSync = fsWriteFileSync as jest.Mock;
+ 
+ describe('PathResolver', () => {
+     let pathResolver: PathResolver;
+ 
+     beforeAll(() => {
+         pathResolver = PathResolver.getInstance();
+     });
+ 
+     afterEach(() => {
+         // Clear mocks and reset PathResolver's cache after each test
+         jest.clearAllMocks();
+         (pathResolver as any).projectRootCache.clear();
+     });
+ 
+     test('should be a singleton instance', () => {
+         const anotherInstance = PathResolver.getInstance();
+         expect(pathResolver).toBe(anotherInstance);
+     });
+ 
+     describe('findProjectRoot', () => {
+         const mockProjectRoot = '/test/project/root';
+         const mockFilePath = '/test/project/root/src/sub/file.md';
+ 
+         test('should find project root with package.json', () => {
+             existsSync.mockImplementation((path: string) => {
+                 return path === nodePathJoin(mockProjectRoot, 'package.json');
+             });
+             expect(pathResolver.findProjectRoot(mockFilePath)).toBe(mockProjectRoot);
+             expect(existsSync).toHaveBeenCalledWith(nodePathJoin('/test/project/root', 'package.json'));
+         });
+ 
+         test('should find project root with .git directory', () => {
+             existsSync.mockImplementation((path: string) => {
+                 return path === nodePathJoin(mockProjectRoot, '.git');
+             });
+             expect(pathResolver.findProjectRoot(mockFilePath)).toBe(mockProjectRoot);
+             expect(existsSync).toHaveBeenCalledWith(nodePathJoin('/test/project/root', '.git'));
+         });
+ 
+         test('should return dirname if no project root found', () => {
+             existsSync.mockReturnValue(false);
+             const filePathWithoutRoot = '/some/random/dir/file.md';
+             expect(pathResolver.findProjectRoot(filePathWithoutRoot)).toBe('/some/random/dir');
+         });
+ 
+         test('should cache project root results', () => {
+             existsSync.mockImplementation((path: string) => {
+                 return path === nodePathJoin(mockProjectRoot, 'package.json');
+             });
+ 
+             pathResolver.findProjectRoot(mockFilePath);
+             expect(existsSync).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1); // First call
+ 
+             pathResolver.findProjectRoot(mockFilePath);
+             expect(existsSync).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1); // Should be cached, no new calls
+         });
+     });
+ 
+     describe('resolve', () => {
+         const mockFromPath = '/home/user/project/src/docs/page.md';
+         const mockProjectRoot = '/home/user/project';
+ 
+         // Mock findProjectRoot for resolve tests
+         let findProjectRootSpy: jest.SpyInstance;
+ 
+         beforeAll(() => {
+             findProjectRootSpy = jest.spyOn(pathResolver, 'findProjectRoot');
+             findProjectRootSpy.mockReturnValue(mockProjectRoot);
+         });
+ 
+         afterEach(() => {
+             findProjectRootSpy.mockClear();
+         });
+ 
+         test('should resolve relative path starting with ./ ', () => {
+             const linkHref = './images/image.png';
+             const expected = '/home/user/project/src/docs/images/image.png';
+             expect(pathResolver.resolve(mockFromPath, linkHref)).toBe(expected);
+             expect(findProjectRootSpy).not.toHaveBeenCalled();
+         });
+ 
+         test('should resolve relative path starting with ../ ', () => {
+             const linkHref = '../assets/doc.pdf';
+             const expected = '/home/user/project/src/assets/doc.pdf';
+             expect(pathResolver.resolve(mockFromPath, linkHref)).toBe(expected);
+             expect(findProjectRootSpy).not.toHaveBeenCalled();
+         });
+ 
+         test('should resolve relative path without explicit ./ or ../', () => {
+             const linkHref = 'another_file.md';
+             const expected = '/home/user/project/src/docs/another_file.md';
+             expect(pathResolver.resolve(mockFromPath, linkHref)).toBe(expected);
+             expect(findProjectRootSpy).not.toHaveBeenCalled();
+         });
+ 
+         test('should resolve absolute path relative to project root', () => {
+             const linkHref = '/components/button.md';
+             const expected = '/home/user/project/components/button.md';
+             expect(pathResolver.resolve(mockFromPath, linkHref)).toBe(expected);
+             expect(findProjectRootSpy).toHaveBeenCalledWith(mockFromPath);
+         });
+ 
+         test('should handle complex relative paths', () => {
+             const complexFromPath = '/a/b/c/d/file.md';
+             const linkHref = '../../../sibling/target.md';
+             const expected = '/a/b/sibling/target.md';
+             expect(pathResolver.resolve(complexFromPath, linkHref)).toBe(expected);
+         });
+ 
+         test('should handle paths with query parameters or fragments', () => {
+             const linkHref = './page.md?param=value#section';
+             const expected = '/home/user/project/src/docs/page.md?param=value#section';
+             // PathResolver should not strip query/fragment, that's LinkResolver's job.
+             expect(pathResolver.resolve(mockFromPath, linkHref)).toBe(expected);
+         });
+ 
+         test('should handle root absolute path', () => {
+             const linkHref = '/root_file.md';
+             const expected = '/home/user/project/root_file.md';
+             expect(pathResolver.resolve(mockFromPath, linkHref)).toBe(expected);
+         });
+     });

+ 
+       // Mock console.log
+       const consoleSpy = jest.spyOn(console, 'log').mockImplementation();
+ 
+       // Test empty directory
+       const options = { noVerify: true };
+ 
+       // Run publish on empty directory
+       await workflowManager.publish(testDir, options);
+ 
+       // Verify appropriate message was logged
+       expect(consoleSpy).toHaveBeenCalledWith('No markdown files found to publish.');
+ 
+       // Clean up mocks
+       mockScanner.mockRestore();
+       consoleSpy.mockRestore();
+     });
+ 
+     test('should handle dry run mode correctly', async () => {
+       // Setup test file
+       const testFile = join(testDir, 'test.md');
+       writeFileSync(testFile, '# Test Article\n\nContent for dry run');
+ 
+       // Mock the publisher
+       const mockPublisher = jest.spyOn(workflowManager['publisher'], 'publishWithMetadata');
+       mockPublisher.mockResolvedValue({
+         success: true,
+         isNewPublication: true,
+         url: 'https://telegra.ph/Test-Article-01-01',
+         path: 'Test-Article-01-01'
+       });
+ 
+       // Test dry run mode
+       const options = { noVerify: true, dryRun: true };
+ 
+       // Run publish in dry run mode
+       await workflowManager.publish(testFile, options);
+ 
+       // Verify publisher was called with dryRun: true
+       expect(mockPublisher).toHaveBeenCalledWith(testFile, 'test-user', expect.objectContaining({
+         dryRun: true
+       }));
+ 
+       // Clean up mocks
+       mockPublisher.mockRestore();
+     });
+   });
+ 
+   describe('error handling', () => {
+     test('should handle workflow exceptions gracefully', async () => {
+       // Setup test file
+       const testFile = join(testDir, 'test.md');
+       writeFileSync(testFile, '# Test Article\n\nContent');
+ 
+       // Mock LinkScanner to throw an error
+       const mockScanner = jest.spyOn(workflowManager['linkScanner'], 'findMarkdownFiles');
+       mockScanner.mockRejectedValue(new Error('Scanner error'));
+ 
+       // Test that the error is propagated
+       const options = { noVerify: true };
+ 
+       await expect(workflowManager.publish(testFile, options)).rejects.toThrow('Scanner error');
+ 
+       // Clean up mocks
+       mockScanner.mockRestore();
+     });
+   });
+ });
```

–¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –¥–∞–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∏–º, —á—Ç–æ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ:

```bash
cd /Users/vedmalex/work/BhaktiVaibhava/–º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª—ã/SatKriyaSaraDipika/sliced_ru && telegraph-publisher --help
```

```
Usage: telegraph-publisher [options] [command]

A CLI tool to publish Markdown content to Telegra.ph with metadata management and dependency resolution.

Options:
  -V, --version                    output the version number
  -h, --help                       display help for command

Commands:
  publish|pub [options]            Unified publish/edit command: creates, publishes, or updates Markdown
                                   files (if no file specified, publishes entire directory)
  analyze [options]                Analyze file dependencies and publication status
  config [options]                 Manage configuration settings
  status [options]                 Show publication status of files
  reset|r [options]                Reset publication metadata, preserving only title
  check-links|cl [options] [path]  Verify and repair local Markdown links
  publish-legacy [options]         Legacy publish command with enhanced workflow (use 'pub' for full
                                   features)
  clean-md <file-path>             Remove Markdown formatting from a file
  list-pages [options]             List published pages on Telegra.ph for a given access token
  help-examples                    Show usage examples
  help [command]                   display help for command

```

---

–û—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ! CLI —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ. –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ–º command, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –≤—ã–∑—ã–≤–∞–ª –æ—à–∏–±–∫—É, –Ω–æ —Å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–º–∏ –æ–ø—Ü–∏—è–º–∏:

–Ø –≤–∏–∂—É –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—É! –û—à–∏–±–∫–∞ –≤—Å–µ –µ—â–µ –≤–æ–∑–Ω–∏–∫–∞–µ—Ç –≤ –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–º –º–µ—Å—Ç–µ - –≤ `buildNodeRecursive` –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–∞ `DependencyManager`, –≥–¥–µ `this.pathResolver` –≤—Å–µ –µ—â–µ `undefined`. –≠—Ç–æ –æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–∞–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –≤—Å–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞ –±—ã–ª–∏ –æ–±–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω—ã –¥–ª—è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞—á–∏ `PathResolver`.

–ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ –≤ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ –≥–¥–µ-—Ç–æ –≤ –∫–æ–¥–µ `DependencyManager` —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –±–µ–∑ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞—á–∏ `PathResolver`. –î–∞–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ –ø–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º, –≥–¥–µ –≤ CLI —ç—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç:
